name: Catterball
description: The Catterball is a small, agile creature resembling a rubbery ball, possessing impressive dexterity and charm. Its notable features include its ability to squeeze through tight spaces and perform incredible leaps.
memorable: Its unique ability to morph and extend its body makes it incredibly difficult to pin down in combat.
goals: Usually seeks to confuse and disrupt its foes with erratic movements.
relations: Often found in the company of other fey creatures.
environment: Typically inhabits enchanted forests or magical glades.
strengths: Excellent mobility, can dodge attacks effectively and escape grapples.
weaknesses: Low Strength and Intelligence makes it poor in physical confrontations.
attacks: Slam attack causing bludgeoning damage and a 'Snap Back' thunder damage ability that affects creatures nearby.
most_powerful_ability: Standing Leap allows it to cover impressive distances in a single jump.
senses: Blindsight out to 30 feet, allowing it to perceive its surroundings without sight.
skills: Possesses passive Perception which helps it notice its environment.
additional_information: Immunity to form-altering spells or effects
Advantage on checks to escape grapples
Can roll into a ball for increased reach
Can be deafened by its own thunder attack
Damages creatures in its radius when returning to true form
test_queries: small elusive fey with impressive leaps
chaotic rubbery fey capable of jumps
monster that can squeeze through tight spaces
confusing small creature with thunder attacks
fey that can change form and evade grapples
